name: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families - Service and Benefits Program
description: VA-accredited specialists provide complimentary assistance to veterans, service members, and their families navigating federal, state, and local benefit programs. Services include disability compensation/pension claim submission, healthcare and cemetery benefit navigation, and claims processing support.

name: VA Healthcare Enrollment
description: Veterans can enroll with the VA health care system to receive healthcare benefits. Benefits vary based on military service period.

name: Maryland Health Connection
description: A one-stop insurance marketplace where individuals and families can shop, compare, and select the right health plan.

name: VA Mental Health Services
description: Covers PTSD, military sexual trauma effects, depression, anxiety, and grief. Available 24/7 regardless of discharge status or VA enrollment.
contact: Veterans Crisis Line: Call 988 and press 1

name: Veterans Crisis Line
description: 24/7 mental health crisis support for veterans. Available via phone, chat, or text.
contact: Call 988 and press 1, Chat at VeteransCrisisLine.net, Text 838255

name: NAMI Maryland
description: Free peer support and education programs for mental health support.

name: On Our Own of Maryland
description: Peer-operated mental health support meetings and services.

name: Vet Center - Combat Veteran Counseling
description: Readjustment counseling services for veterans and families who served in combat zones including Vietnam, Southwest Asia, OEF, OIF, and other deployments.

name: Baltimore Station
description: Therapeutic residential program supporting veterans transitioning through poverty, addiction, and homelessness toward self-sufficiency.

name: Maryland Center for Veterans Education and Training
description: Nonprofit providing comprehensive services enabling veterans to rejoin their communities, including housing and education support.

name: VA Community Resource and Referral Centers
description: Centers coordinate with local partners to provide services to homeless veterans and family members, including assistance with housing, employment, health care, benefits, and more. On-site shower, laundry, and meal services available.

name: Supportive Services for Veterans and Their Families (SSVF)
description: Eligible veteran families receive case management and assistance obtaining benefits, housing counseling, and legal services to prevent eviction and foreclosure.

name: Charlotte Hall Veterans Home
description: Provides assisted living and skilled nursing programs to eligible veterans aged 62 and over.

name: Maryland Housing Search
description: Online resource showcasing rental properties filtered by area, cost, bedrooms/bathrooms, and voucher acceptance.

name: Disability Compensation for Service-Connected Veterans
description: Property tax exemptions on primary residence for veterans who are permanently and totally disabled from service-connected causes.

name: Maryland Tax Exemptions for Veterans
description: Tax relief programs including property tax exemptions and tax deductions for eligible veterans.

name: Maryland State Parks - Free Entry for Veterans
description: Free entry to all state parks for resident and nonresident veterans.

name: Maryland Veterans Services Specialist Program
description: Professional advocacy services staffed by VA-accredited specialists at regional offices throughout Maryland.

name: Veterans Service Animal Program
description: Program providing assistance and resources related to service animals for eligible veterans.

name: Restoration of Honor Act
description: Specialized veteran support program through the Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families.

name: Maryland Veterans Cemetery and Memorial Services
description: Burial and memorial services for eligible veterans.

name: Maryland Veterans Education Benefits
description: Educational assistance programs for veterans and eligible dependents.

name: Maryland Veterans Motor Vehicle Benefits
description: Vehicle-related benefits for eligible veterans.

name: Maryland Substance Use Disorder Services
description: Treatment and care plans for substance use disorder including alcohol, cannabis, opioid, and stimulant disorders provided through Maryland VA service centers.
